reviewText: It is extremely rare to have concert footage that includes Jonathan Livingston Seagull and Morningside.  This DVD live in Australia performance in front of 38,000 Aussies has an extensive song selection from the amazingJonathan Livingston Seagull: Original Motion Picture SoundtrackORJonathan Livingston Seagull: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack.  It's rare to ever hear this on his concerts.  So many beautiful and fun songs are here.At one time, Diamond gets comfortable chatting with the audience, engaging them into Song Sung  Blue.  This audience participation went on a little too long!  Time is precious in concerts and I would much rather hear the performer.Morningside is here!What is more rare and a wonderful addition included in the special features is Morningside!  If you ever want the best version of Morningside, try the double CD,Neil Diamond - The Greatest Hits (1966-1992)an amazing and mesmerizing live treasure of that song.Interview with NeilA lengthy interview reveals who Neil Diamond is,  Forget that the interviewer had the audacity to ask him how much money he had!!  Wow!  When asked, Diamond explained that a benefit with financial gain is to buy your privacy, freedom, which average person doesn't need to do.The interviewer also tried to pigeonhole Diamond into exploring the question about getting "a message" out.  Diamond clearly and often explained his music is about emotions, feelings, thoughts and not "a message."Since the DVD is from a 1976 concert, the sound is good!  He dressed good, and looks good!!  The features are few, but listen to the interview!  It would have been nice to have a stereo effect, but hey, anything by him is a treat!!  I recommend another classic performanceNeil Diamond: Love at the Greek.  I doubt if this is on DVD, but is another best!  ......Rizzo
summary: Morningside & Jonathan Livingston Seagull are HERE!!

reviewText: I was quite happy to see this dvd being offered here. This video really captures Neil the way he performed in the mid 70's. The songs and performances are excellent throughout. Included in the set is an intimate and at times very revealing in-studio interview with Neil.The packaging on this set is top notch as well.  Along with a nice booklet with photos and info on the concert, there is a mini poster, which is a reproduction from the Sydney Independent. Now maybe we can get Love at the Greek and some other shows from this era on dvd!

reviewText: I can't believe the negative reviews! This is by far the best Neil Diamond DVD out there! Sure, if you like all that Heartlight/Coming-to-America/Bring-me-no-flowers crap, and if you like his glittery costumes and Vegas schtick, then you'll hate this DVD. Mainly because ND was still a great songwriter/performer at this point. After 1976, Neil slowly moved into the realm of shlocky muzak balladeer, down there with Lionel Richie & Leo Sayer. Some reviewers complain about the sound. If you have a decent stereo TV, this sounds fine. Just turn it up. Those with 5.1 surround sound and a pristine home theater will hate this and most 60's & '70's DVD's. Such people wouldn't be happy unless Neil played in their freaking living room! Yes, I think Hot August Night is his undisputed peak, but until that is released on DVD, this Australian show stands as classic Neil Diamond. I subtract one star for the cheesy '70's synthesizer that replaces counter-melody guitar lines on Cracklin' Rosie & a few others. Thankfully, there are no disco songs to cringe over.
summary: 1976... The Final Frontier for Neil Diamond

reviewText: In 1972 Neil recorded his classic live albumHot August Night (Remastered / Expanded) (2CD). It was the very first Neil Diamond album I ever bought, and although I have bought most of his albums, it remains the single album I listen to most to this day, and I consider it his best work.I often wondered what it would be like to have been there to witness that historic event, and  I did not know this dvd existed until I accidentally encountered it in my local record store a few days ago.A little bit of research shows the level of Neil's popularity in Australia.  His Hot August Night album was No 1 for a staggering 29 weeks in Australia, and reputedly owned in 1 out of every 4 households.  This particular concert was broadcast live throughout Australia. It also set an attendance record at the Sydney sports grounds.As I watched the video I noticed that this was Hot August night brought to visual life. The shimmering presence, the showmanship, the sparkly shirt, the beautiful rhythms, the rich resonant voice, and holding the stadium and the nation in the palm of his hand.Quite simply, Australia Tribute is an opportunity to witness Neil at his very best.Some other reviewers have made issue about the sound quality.  I have a 42 inch Panasonic Plasma tv with standard tv speakers.  I noticed on the second song a little bit of hiss at the end, and turned down the treble and it disappeared.  The colors were a little bright and I also had to adjust the colors a little.  Other than that everything was perfect.The extras with this dvd are excellent, and include Neil Diamond's first extended tv interview, 47 minutes, quite revealing, and the live commercial breaks from the stage with Neil being the sponsor are very amusing.  A perfect gift for a Neil Diamond fan, or for yourself.I hope you found this review helpful, and I think you'll love it.
summary: An essential dvd from a legendary artist
Title: N/A

reviewText: Two hours of Neil playing great acoustic rock & roll with his classic band, the same folks who played on the immortal "Hot August Night" concert four years prior. Diamond was coming off of a concert sabbatical, filling stadiums throughout Australia and New Zealand. In appreciation of this great support, he allowed the last show to be televised live across Oz, nearly in it's entirety. And what a show it was--the version of Cherry,Cherry may have surpassed the HAN performance. I could have done without the lengthy "Johnathan Livingston Seagull medley which dominated the second half, but it had just been a massive hit, especially in that country. Video quality is better than most from that era, audio is acceptable stereo, echoey but with nice instrument separation.Don't miss the live onstage commercials, comprising about five minutes of the bonus features. Hilariously cynical readings of a script for candy bars and stereo equipment-good fun!
summary: Diamond is golden in his prime.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the best Neil Diamond DVD to come out. Other Neil Diamond Dvds are either chopped up Tv specials or 60 min made for TV affairs. Not so with "Thank you Ausrailla" concert in March 1976. Recorded before a large crowd of 38000 people(a record at the time)You get the complete 2 hour concert plus bonus features.Most experts agree that it's better to film a concert rather than videotaping it. However, It appears that the tapes have been preserved and taken care of. The quality of the picture and sound are very good.There is a bonus track of "Morningside", which has been restored. During the origanal broadcast, it was cut short by a comerical break. I wish they would have edited this song into the concert. This is only a minor thing-no big deal.If you are a diamond fan, you will want this DVD. Buy it. You won't find a more complete Neil Diamond concert on DVD than this!
summary: The Best Neil Diamond DVD ever!
Title: N/A

reviewText: All these reviews have made excellent points, and the shortcomings, from today's perspective, have been validly pointed out - but I want to emphasize that this concert was 33 YEARS AGO! Yes, we have come a LONG way since then in audio/video production for live concerts, but we must understand that wasn't the way it was in those days. And, yes, Neil is older now ... but: AREN'T WE ALL? Putting it all into perspective: ABBA had just barely won the Eurovision Song Contest and were just barely getting off the ground. Now, doesn't THAT seem like it happened in the Stone Age? So much has happened since those days. IF you are a Neil Diamond fan, appreciate this concert for what it was then: totally dynamic. Speaking just for myself: I feel darn lucky to have come across this DVD and have added it to my collection ... love it! It arrived today, and I IMMEDIATELY sat down and watched it. Sure, we WISH we had the modern production techniques back then to have smoothed all sorts of stuff out (such as not having TV cameras with numerous low shots into glaring overhead lights), but I'm sure they did the best with what they had at the time. As I mentioned in a prior review of his HOT AUGUST NIGHT/NYC performance (DVD): we saw his show live in Paris the year after this '76 concert. Yes, it was classic (young) Neil Diamond ... dynamic ... awesome performance. And this DVD reminds me so much of that Paris gig. I will put in a plug for the HOT AUGUST NIGHT/NYC DVD, again, however. It HAS all the modern audio/video techniques fully utilized ... with a bigger band ... totally awesome experience. I would unhesitatingly recommend BOTH DVDs for your collection if you're a fan.UPDATE:  11-06-09:  Just watched this concert again. It was the first time since my initial review, above. We turned off the lights, cranked up the sound, and WE WERE THERE! This concert is totally absorbing. Diamond has those 38,000 people at the concert ... and my wife and I here at home ... in the palm of his hand. Classic Diamond songs ... powerful ... VERY powerful. His music has always appealed to my very soul, and it was not a whit different tonight watching the concert again. I was transformed back to the time of long hair, flowered shirts, bell-bottomed jeans, and great ... GREAT ... Neil Diamond music! I am sooooo glad I had the opportunity to buy this superb DVD!Over ... and out ... :-)

reviewText: I saw this DVD at my brother`s place, a few days ago, and I just ordered it. This is the visual closest approximation to what the original 1972 Hot Agust Night must have been. It's a real pitty to think that the original 72 performance never saw the light as an official DVD. But this is a very good replacement. It`s Neil Diamond flying with all his magic and inspiration just as he did on that lovely Greek Theater Performance. And almost the same repertoire. For all of us who cherish the 60's even during this horrific and mediocre times of no magic, no poetry, no artistic coherence and so much comercial trash, this is just like a deserved old bottle of the finest wine. Just come and share a drink from it!

reviewText: Ever try to look up an artist and pick out THE CONCERT? You know that special night when it all came together.Takes a lot of research. Seeing what a lot of folks say positive and negative about each major concert. And is there anything worse than watching an older performer talk their way thru notes they can no longer hit? Well this was Neil Diamond at his peak. Although New York in 2010 wasn't bad either.

reviewText: This is a MUST HAVE for any Neil Diamond fan.  I consider it the BEST CONCERT FOOTAGE of Neil Diamond to date for it's wonderful song selection, the fact that it's unedited, and for Neil's good choice of wardrobe...seriously.  (The "Love At The Greek," "Greatest Hits Live" and even the more recent "Stages" concert footage all capture him wearing outfits that are amongst the worst he's worn, and don't go with the deep introspection and rock edge of his music.)This DVD captures the "James Dean" quality in Diamond's stage performance that was such a part of his early career, but  never preserved on film....until now.Also, there's an highly unusual 45 minute long interview with Neil Diamond in the "Bonus Features" section where the interviewer asks Neil some of the most personal and unusual questions you can imagine.  Intriguing.
summary: Unedited.  Great.  Unusual 45 minute Interview with Neil as Bonus Feature.
